description.narrative: Morocco - Small-Scale Fisheries Project: Transform the small-scale fisheries sector by: constructing landing sites, building/upgrading fishery facilities; building wholesale markets; providing technical assistance; partially funding fresh-fish transportation equipment for mobile fish vendors; and establishing marine protected areas and increasing efforts to ensure sustainable use of fish resources.

title.narrative: Measuring Results of the Small-Scale Fisheries Project in Morocco

condition.narrative: 20) Before entering into any contract(s) with consultants to conduct any Environmental Impact Assessment ("EIA") or perform any design work for Project 2 (Small Scale Fisheries Project), MCA-Morocco shall establish an environmental and social unit within Office National des Peches, such environmental and social unit to be in a form and with a scope of responsibility satisfactory to MCC.

33) Before entering into any contract(s) with consultants to conduct any Environmental Impact Assessment ("EIA") or perform any design work for Project 2 (Small Scale Fisheries Project), MCA-Morocco shall establish an environmental and social unit within Office National des Peches, such environmental and social unit to be in a form and with a scope of responsibility satisfactory to MCC. Such environmental and social unit shall remain in place and shall be sufficiently staffed and mobilized (to MCC's satisfaction) throughout the term of the Compact

34) In accordance with the requirements and schedule for tranches of work as determined and approved by MCA-Morocco and MCC, MCA-Morocco shall ensure that, satisfactory to MCC, 1) EIA(s) and site-specific EMPs have been completed; and 2) relevant Resettlement Action Plans (RAPs) have been developed, and implemented at no cost to MCA Compact funds in accordance with the World Bank Policy on Involuntary Resettlement (OP 4.12)
Further details on conditions precedent affecting this activity can be found in the top-level parent activities.

title.narrative: Net annual income of boats at PDAs and ports
